title: Industrial Tool Rental with Pickups and Drop-Offs
content: A tool rental company manages multiple regional hubs (<loc_depot>) to deliver equipment to construction sites (linehaul) and collect returned tools (backhaul). Rentals require precise drop-off (<time_window>) and pickup windows, while route durations (<time_limit>) must fit within technicians’ workdays. Vehicle capacities (<capacity>) must handle mixed loads of new and returned gear, with demands varying by location (<demand_linehaul>, <demand_backhaul>). The objective is to balance depot workloads and minimize delays caused by overscheduling or underutilized trucks.

title: Emergency Blood Plasma Delivery and Blood Donation Collection
content: Blood banks across a region operate from multiple depots (<loc_depot>) to deliver plasma to hospitals (linehaul) and collect blood donations from mobile drives (backhaul). Plasma deliveries must arrive within hospitals’ receiving hours (<time_window>), and donation pickups require coordination with drive schedules. Routes must adhere to strict duration limits (<time_limit>) to maintain plasma viability, while vehicle capacity (<capacity>) accommodates both perishable deliveries and donations. The challenge is to synchronize time-critical pickups and drop-offs across depots, ensuring all blood products are transported efficiently without exceeding capacity constraints.

title: Urban Electric Taxi Battery Swap Logistics Network
content: A city operates multiple battery swap depots (MD) to service electric taxis. Each depot dispatches vehicles (capacity `<capacity>`) to deliver charged batteries to taxi stands and collect depleted ones. Taxis require swaps within strict time windows (TW) to avoid downtime. Routes must ensure deliveries precede pickups (MB) without overloading vehicles, and all operations must conclude within daily operational hours (L). The goal is to minimize taxi wait times while balancing depot workloads and adhering to capacity constraints.

title: Disaster Response Equipment Redistribution & Salvage Logistics
content: After a flood, regional depots (MD) distribute rescue equipment (e.g., pumps, generators) to affected zones and collect salvageable materials (e.g., debris, reusable tools). Each zone has critical time windows (TW) for equipment delivery. Vehicles (capacity `<capacity>`) must return within 24 hours (L), ensuring capacity prioritizes life-saving gear before collecting salvage. Mixed backhaul allows flexible delivery-pickup sequences while respecting load limits.

title: Live Event Stage Setup & Equipment Recovery Logistics
content: A concert tour uses multiple depots (MD) to deliver staging equipment (trusses, speakers) to venues and recover gear afterward. Venues mandate setup completion by specific time windows (TW) to meet event schedules. Vehicles (capacity `<capacity>`) must return to depots within a day (L), balancing delivery of new equipment (linehaul) and pickup of used gear (backhaul). Routes must avoid overloading trucks during mixed operations.

title: Medical Imaging Equipment Rental & Recycling Network
content: A healthcare firm rents MRI/CT scanners from depots (MD) to hospitals and retrieves outdated units for recycling. Rentals must arrive before scheduled scans (TW), while pickups occur post-use. Vehicles (capacity `<capacity>`) handle both new and old equipment, ensuring delivery prioritization (MB). Routes must finish within clinic operating hours (L), minimizing downtime and maximizing fleet utilization.

title: Coastal Fresh Seafood Delivery & Ice Container Recycling Network
content: A seafood company operates coastal depots (MD) to deliver fresh catches (e.g., fish, shellfish) to markets and collect empty ice containers. Markets demand deliveries by morning time windows (TW) to ensure freshness. Vehicles (capacity `<capacity>`) must return by noon (L), balancing perishable cargo (linehaul) and container pickups (backhaul). Mixed backhaul ensures ice containers don’t reduce delivery capacity.

title: Pop-Up Retail Event Equipment Redistribution & Post-Event Recovery Network
content: A company manages temporary pop-up retail events in multiple cities. They use regional warehouses (<loc_depot>) as depots to deliver modular store fixtures and inventory to event locations (<loc_customer>) while also collecting used equipment post-event. Each truck (<capacity> ton capacity) must first deliver linehaul items (e.g., displays, merchandise) and later backtrack to collect backhaul items (e.g., disassembled structures). Time windows (<time_windows>) enforce strict setup and teardown deadlines, while duration limits (<L>) ensure drivers complete routes within an 8-hour workday. The challenge is to balance depot assignments, avoid overloading vehicles, and synchronize deliveries with event schedules.

title: IT Hardware Deployment to Remote Work Locations with Collection Logistics
content: A tech firm dispatches laptops and peripherals to remote employees from regional distribution centers (<loc_depot>). Trucks (<capacity> unit capacity) must first deliver linehaul devices and later retrieve returned hardware after contract expiration. Employees require deliveries within specific work hours (<time_windows>), while pickups must occur within a 48-hour window post-termination. Each vehicle’s route must stay under a 6-hour duration limit (<L>), and depot selection depends on geographic proximity. Mixed backhauls require ensuring returned devices don’t exceed remaining truck capacity after deliveries.

title: Holiday Decoration Delivery & Post-Season Collection Network
content: A home goods retailer stocks seasonal decorations (e.g., Christmas lights, ornaments) to retail stores (<loc_customer>) from regional warehouses (<loc_depot>). Trucks (<capacity> cubic meter capacity) must first deliver festive items before the holiday rush, then collect unsold inventory afterward. Stores enforce strict delivery (<time_windows_open>) and pickup (<time_windows_close>) windows, with duration limits (<L>) preventing overnight routes. The mixed backhaul requires optimizing truck space to carry both outbound and inbound loads without exceeding capacity during reverse logistics phases.

title: Automotive Parts Supply Chain with Defective Component Retrieval
content: An automotive supplier distributes new engine components to dealerships (<loc_customer>) while collecting defective parts from service centers. Multi-depot (<loc_depot>) operations prioritize regional efficiency. Linehaul deliveries must arrive before dealership operating hours end (<time_windows>), while backhaul pickups of faulty parts must occur within 48 hours of defect reporting. Each truck (<capacity> kg capacity) must handle mixed loads without exceeding limits, and route durations (<L>) must align with warranty service SLAs.

title: Film Production Equipment Delivery & Set Dismantling Logistics
content: A film production company coordinates equipment transport for movie shoots across multiple locations. Gear (e.g., cameras, lighting) is distributed from equipment hubs (<loc_depot>) to film sets (<loc_customer>), then retrieved after filming concludes. Tight time windows (<time_windows>) govern setup and teardown timelines, while duration limits (<L>) ensure trucks complete round trips within shooting schedules. Mixed backhauls require vehicles to first deliver heavy equipment before returning with dismantled sets, adhering to payload constraints (<capacity>). Depot assignments depend on proximity to filming regions.

title: International Tech Expo Equipment Deployment and Retrieval Network
content: An international tech expo requires rapid deployment of booths, screens, and networking gear to multiple venues across cities. Each venue (linehaul) must receive equipment by specified time windows, while post-event dismantling (backhaul) collects used items. Multiple depots in regional hubs supply and collect equipment, with vehicles constrained by cargo capacity. Routes must adhere to strict duration limits to ensure setup is completed before event start and teardown finishes within contracted hours.

title: Urban EV Charging Station Maintenance and Battery Swap Logistics
content: Electric vehicle charging stations across a city require regular maintenance and battery swaps. Technicians from multiple depots must deliver replacement parts (linehaul) to malfunctioning stations and collect faulty components (backhaul) for recycling. Each service call has a time window tied to off-peak hours to minimize disruption. Vehicles must not exceed their payload capacity (e.g., carrying both tools and batteries) and complete all tasks within an 8-hour shift duration limit.

title: Hospital Linen and Medical Supply Redistribution Network
content: A healthcare system operates from multiple depots to deliver clean linens and medical supplies to hospitals (linehaul) while simultaneously collecting soiled laundry and expired medical waste (backhaul). Each hospital has time windows for deliveries/pickups aligned with shift changes. Vehicles must respect strict capacity limits to avoid overloading, and routes must be completed within a 12-hour window to ensure overnight replenishment.

title: Tourist Shuttle Services with Adventure Gear Rental Logistics
content: A travel company manages shuttle buses that deliver snorkeling gear, hiking equipment, and cameras to tourist hotspots (linehaul) and collect them post-use (backhaul). Shuttles depart from regional depots and must adhere to tourists’ booked time windows (e.g., beach visits between 9 AM–12 PM). Buses have limited storage space, and routes must be planned to avoid exceeding a 6-hour operational window to maximize daily service capacity.

title: Agricultural Drone Battery Redistribution and Crop Sample Collection
content: Farmers in a large agricultural region require drone batteries for crop monitoring and soil sampling. A logistics firm operates from multiple depots to deliver charged batteries (linehaul) to drone operators in the field and collect depleted batteries and crop samples (backhaul). Each farm has time windows for service based on irrigation schedules. Vehicles must stay under weight limits to accommodate both batteries and samples, and routes must be completed within a 4-hour window to ensure uninterrupted drone operations.

title: Urban Microgrid Battery Redistribution & Solar Panel Pickup Network
content: A network of solar-powered microgrids operates across a city, managed from multiple depots (`<loc_depot>`). Each depot dispatches electric vehicles (capacity `<capacity>`) to deliver charged batteries to solar energy stations during morning hours (TW: 6-9 AM) and collect discharged batteries for recharging in the evening (TW: 6-9 PM). Simultaneously, the same vehicles must pick up outdated solar panels (`demand_backhaul`) from rooftops during daylight (TW: 9 AM-3 PM) for recycling. Routes must ensure no vehicle exceeds its battery-carrying capacity (`<capacity>`) and completes all tasks within an 8-hour shift (`<time_limit>`), returning to their origin depot by 5 PM.

title: Live Event Stage Equipment Deployment & Post-Show Recovery Logistics
content: A touring theater production requires setting up elaborate stages in different cities, using multiple regional equipment depots (`<loc_depot>`). Trucks (capacity `<capacity>`) must deliver stage components (linehaul `<demand_linehaul>`) to venues before curtain-up (TW: 2 hours pre-show) and collect dismantled equipment (backhaul `<demand_backhaul>`) after the final performance (TW: midnight). Each route is constrained by a 12-hour working window (`<time_limit>`) to allow crew rest, and vehicles must return to their assigned depot for overnight storage. The challenge is balancing load capacities for both delivery and pickup while adhering to tight showtime deadlines.

title: Pharmaceutical Cold Chain Distribution & Expired Drug Retrieval
content: A global pharmaceutical company operates from three temperature-controlled depots (`<loc_depot>`) to deliver vaccines (linehaul `<demand_linehaul>`) and collect expired medications (backhaul `<demand_backhaul>`) across rural clinics (`<loc_customer>`). Vehicles have refrigeration units with a 10-hour operational limit (`<time_limit>`), requiring return to depots before battery depletion. Each clinic has strict delivery windows (TW: 8 AM-12 PM) for vaccine storage and pickup windows (TW: 3-5 PM) for waste disposal. The capacity (`<capacity>`) must account for both perishable deliveries and biohazard pickups, with no mixing of expired and active medications allowed.

title: Offshore Research Vessel Supply & Scientific Sample Collection
content: Marine researchers use multiple coastal supply depots (`<loc_depot>`) to service offshore research vessels. Vessels require fuel and equipment deliveries (linehaul `<demand_linehaul>`) during daytime windows (TW: 9 AM-4 PM) and must return scientific samples (backhaul `<demand_backhaul>`) via pickup before sunset (TW: 6-8 PM). Supply boats (`<capacity>`) have a 12-hour operational limit (`<time_limit>`) due to tidal restrictions, necessitating round-trip returns to depots. Routes must prioritize urgent sample collections while ensuring fuel and cargo capacities are not exceeded during storm-prone evenings.

title: High-Speed Rail Maintenance & Worn Component Recovery
content: A rail network’s maintenance teams operate from five regional depots (`<loc_depot>`), dispatching trains to inspect track sections (`<loc_customer>`). Inspectors deliver replacement parts (linehaul `<demand_linehaul>`) during morning maintenance windows (TW: 6-10 AM) and collect worn components (backhaul `<demand_backhaul>`) post-inspection (TW: 2-6 PM). Each inspection train has a 10-hour operational limit (`<time_limit>`), enforced by mandatory safety checks at depots. Capacity (`<capacity>`) must accommodate both deliveries and pickups, with strict weight limits to prevent derailment risks on aging tracks.

title: Renewable Energy Solar Panel Installation & Recycling Network
content: A solar energy company operates multiple regional depots (`<loc_depot>`) to deploy installation teams. Each truck carries new panels (`<demand_linehaul>`) and collects old panels for recycling (`<demand_backhaul>`). Vehicles must not exceed `<capacity>` kg, serve all sites within their `<time_window>` (e.g., matching technician availability), and complete routes within an `<L>`-hour workday. The challenge is balancing load capacity while coordinating deliveries and pickups across scattered locations (`<loc_customer>`), ensuring timely installations and recycling pickups without overtime.

title: Urban Electric Scooter Battery Swap Logistics with Peak Demand Constraints
content: An e-scooter company manages `<loc_depot>` battery swap hubs in a city. During peak hours, trucks must deliver charged batteries (`<demand_linehaul>`) to low-stock stations and collect depleted ones (`<demand_backhaul>`) without exceeding `<capacity>` batteries per vehicle. Each swap station has a `<time_window>` during rush hour for service. Routes must finish within an `<L>`-hour shift, avoiding traffic delays, while optimizing battery redistribution across `<loc_customer>` locations.

title: Disaster Relief Cargo Redistribution & Hazardous Waste Collection
content: After a flood, aid agencies use `<loc_depot>` regional depots to send relief supplies (`<demand_linehaul>`) to disaster zones (`<loc_customer>`) and collect contaminated waste (`<demand_backhaul>`). Trucks must adhere to strict `<time_window>` delivery deadlines (e.g., before nightfall), return to depots within `<L>` hours to reload, and avoid overloading (`<capacity>` ton limit). The mixed backhaul routes require managing perishable supplies and hazardous materials while balancing multi-depot resource allocations.

title: Airport Catering Supply & Waste Collection Network
content: An airline caterer operates from `<loc_depot>` kitchens to deliver meals (`<demand_linehaul>`) to departing flights and collect unused food waste (`<demand_backhaul>`) from aircraft. Each vehicle’s `<capacity>` must accommodate meal boxes and waste containers. Deliveries and pickups must align with flight schedules’ `<time_window>` (e.g., 30 minutes pre-departure), while ensuring round-trip durations stay under `<L>` hours. Multi-depot coordination is critical for handling simultaneous gate operations across terminals.

title: High-Tech Semiconductor Component Deployment & Defective Part Retrieval
content: A semiconductor manufacturer uses `<loc_depot>` regional warehouses to deliver precision components (`<demand_linehaul>`) to assembly lines and retrieve defective parts (`<demand_backhaul>`). Trucks must maintain strict `<capacity>` limits to prevent damage, comply with factory `<time_window>` access periods (e.g., shift start/end), and complete all deliveries/pickups within an `<L>`-hour window to avoid production delays. Mixed backhaul routes must dynamically prioritize urgent orders while balancing multi-depot workflows.

title: Medical Diagnostic Equipment Redistribution & Sample Collection Network
content: A network of diagnostic laboratories operates from multiple regional hubs (`<loc_depot>`) to serve hospitals and clinics across a large area. Vehicles must deliver new medical equipment (linehaul) to facilities requiring upgrades while collecting blood samples and diagnostic specimens (backhaul) for analysis. Each hospital has strict time windows (`<time_windows>`) for receiving equipment and submitting samples, with service times (`<service_time>`) for equipment setup and sample collection. Routes must originate and end at their assigned depot, stay within an 8-hour shift duration (`<time_limit>`), and ensure that vehicle capacities (`<capacity>`) are not exceeded by the combined weight of equipment and samples.

title: Urban Drone Courier Network with Time-Sensitive Deliveries & Returns
content: A city-wide drone delivery service uses multiple launch sites (`<loc_depot>`) to handle both parcel deliveries (linehaul) and returns (backhaul). Drones must comply with strict time windows (`<time_windows>`) for customer pickups/drop-offs, adhering to service times (`<service_time>`) for package handling. Each drone has a maximum flight duration (`<time_limit>`) due to battery constraints and a payload capacity (`<capacity>`), limiting the number of packages carried per trip. Routes must start/end at the assigned depot and balance delivery and return stops without exceeding operational limits.

title: Construction Prefabrication Module Delivery & Waste Retrieval
content: A construction company with regional depots (`<loc_depot>`) delivers prefabricated building modules (linehaul) to active sites (`<loc_customer>`) while collecting scrap materials and excess waste (backhaul) for recycling. Each site has time windows (`<time_windows>`) for crane availability and waste pickup, with service times (`<service_time>`) for module installation coordination. Vehicles must return to their origin depot within an 8-hour window (`<time_limit>`) and cannot exceed their capacity (`<capacity>`) when carrying mixed loads of modules and waste.

title: Perishable Seafood Distribution & Ice Container Recycling
content: A seafood distributor operates from multiple coastal depots (`<loc_depot>`) to deliver fresh catch (linehaul) to restaurants and supermarkets (`<loc_customer>`) while retrieving empty ice-filled containers (backhaul) for reuse. Time windows (`<time_windows>`) are critical to ensure seafood freshness, with service times (`<service_time>`) for loading/unloading perishables. Routes must stay within a 6-hour duration (`<time_limit>`) to maintain cold chain integrity and avoid overloading trucks (`<capacity>`) with combined seafood and container weights.

title: Automotive Showroom Inventory Redistribution & Defective Part Retrieval
content: An automotive retailer with regional showrooms (`<loc_depot>`) redistributes new car parts (linehaul) to dealerships while collecting defective components (backhaul) for warranty repairs. Each dealership has time windows (`<time_windows>`) for parts delivery and pickup, with service times (`<service_time>`) for inventory checks. Routes must originate/end at the assigned depot, stay within a 10-hour working day (`<time_limit>`), and respect vehicle capacities (`<capacity>`) for the mixed load of new/defective parts.

title: Medical Oxygen Delivery & Cylinder Pickup Network
content: A network of regional medical depots (`<loc_depot>`) supplies hospitals (`<loc_customer>`) with oxygen tanks while collecting empty cylinders for recycling. Vehicles must deliver oxygen (linehaul) before picking up empties (backhaul) without exceeding `<capacity>` kg. Hospitals have strict `<time_windows>` for receiving deliveries during daytime and accepting pickups post-shift. Routes must be completed within `<time_limit>` hours to ensure oxygen availability for overnight critical care.

title: Airport Catering and Waste Collection Logistics
content: Multiple airport depots (`<loc_depot>`) coordinate to deliver fresh meals to departing flights (`<loc_customer>`) and collect food waste for disposal. Each vehicle’s `<capacity>` must accommodate meal containers and waste bins. Flights impose `<time_windows>` for meal delivery before departure and waste pickup post-landing. Routes are constrained by `<time_limit>` to align with aircraft turnaround schedules, ensuring no delays.

title: Urban Pharmacy Delivery & Expired Medicine Retrieval
content: Pharmacies across a city (`<loc_depot>`) dispatch vans to restock neighborhood clinics (`<loc_customer>`) with medications and retrieve expired drugs. The `<capacity>` limits the combined weight of new stock and expired items. Clinics mandate `<time_windows>` for morning deliveries and afternoon pickups to avoid disrupting patient hours. Routes must finish within `<time_limit>` to accommodate evening inventory audits.

title: Construction Site Tool Delivery & Equipment Pickup
content: Regional tool warehouses (`<loc_depot>`) service construction sites (`<loc_customer>`) by delivering tools and collecting damaged equipment. Trucks have `<capacity>` constraints for bulky tools and scrap metal. Sites specify `<time_windows>` for morning deliveries and afternoon pickups to align with shift changes. Routes must adhere to `<time_limit>` to complete before evening safety shutdowns.

title: Electric Bus Depot Battery Exchange Network
content: Electric bus depots (`<loc_depot>`) in a metropolitan area redistribute charged batteries to bus terminals (`<loc_customer>`) and collect depleted ones for recharging. Vehicles must first deliver charged batteries (linehaul) before retrieving empties (backhaul), staying under `<capacity>` weight limits. Terminals enforce `<time_windows>` during shift swaps, and routes must finish within `<time_limit>` to ensure overnight charging capacity.

title: Tech Event Equipment Deployment & Post-Event Recovery Network
content: A global tech conference requires rapid setup and teardown of booths across multiple city venues. Regional warehouses (<loc_depot>) dispatch trucks with a maximum capacity of `<capacity>` units to deliver booth components (linehaul) to venues (<loc_customer>) within strict setup time windows. After the event, trucks must collect dismantled equipment (backhaul) without exceeding their capacity. Routes must adhere to daily driving limits (`<time_limit>` hours) to ensure crews finish within shift durations. Time windows for delivery and pickup are enforced to avoid disrupting event schedules, while ensuring all equipment is redistributed efficiently between depots.

title: Urban Emergency Medical Supply Redistribution & Critical Waste Collection
content: A city’s emergency response system uses `<loc_depot>` medical hubs to distribute life-saving supplies (linehaul) to hospitals during a crisis. Simultaneously, trucks collect hazardous medical waste (backhaul) from affected sites (<loc_customer>). Each vehicle has a capacity limit of `<capacity>` kg to balance delivery and pickup loads. Routes must respect hospital-specific time windows for urgent deliveries and waste pickup schedules. Duration constraints (`<time_limit>` hours) ensure drivers comply with health-and-safety shift limits while covering all critical locations.

title: International Trade Fair Equipment Delivery & Secure Retrieval
content: A multinational trade fair in multiple cities demands rapid deployment of booth materials to venues (<loc_customer>) using depots (<loc_depot>) in each region. Trucks with `<capacity>`-unit capacity must deliver equipment (linehaul) within setup time windows and retrieve it post-event (backhaul) without exceeding load limits. Routes must fit within the fair’s operational period (`<time_limit>` hours), and depots must coordinate to ensure timely retrieval while avoiding cross-regional overloads. Time windows align with venue access rules, and duration limits prevent overnight driving.

title: Urban Solar Panel Installation & Battery Recycling Network
content: A renewable energy company operates from `<loc_depot>` distribution centers to deliver solar panels (linehaul) to residential rooftops (<loc_customer>) and collect retired batteries (backhaul) for recycling. Each truck’s `<capacity>` must accommodate mixed loads, prioritizing panel deliveries before pickups. Time windows enforce daytime installation and battery collection schedules. Duration limits (`<time_limit>` hours) ensure technicians finish installations within work shifts, optimizing route efficiency while balancing depot workloads.

title: Live Event Catering Equipment Redistribution & Post-Event Recovery
content: Catering firms use `<loc_depot>` central kitchens to supply equipment (linehaul) to event venues (<loc_customer>) and retrieve used gear afterward (backhaul). Trucks have a `<capacity>` limit to handle both deliveries and pickups. Time windows align with event start/end times, requiring precise scheduling to avoid disruptions. Routes must conclude within `<time_limit>` hours to accommodate same-day shifts, while multi-depot coordination ensures efficient coverage of simultaneous events across the city.
